info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued November 15 at 1:36PM EST until November 16 at 6:00PM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City NC
info.description:
...DANGEROUS FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS POSSIBLE SUNDAY...
.Breezy winds, low relative humidities, ongoing drought, and a wind shift with a cold front are forecast on Sunday, leading to the potential for dangerous fire weather conditions.
The National Weather Service in Newport/Morehead City has issued a Fire Weather Watch for gusty winds, low relative humidities, and a wind shift, which is in effect from Sunday morning through Sunday afternoon.
* AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 029 Martin, Fire Weather Zone 044 Pitt and Fire Weather Zone 079 Greene.
* TIMING...From Sunday morning through Sunday afternoon.
* WINDS...West 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 35 mph.
* RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 20 to 25 percent.
* TEMPERATURES...Low to mid 70s.
* IMPACTS...Any fire that develops will catch and spread quickly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

parameter.value: FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON FOR GUSTY WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, AND A WIND SHIFT FOR PORTIONS OF THE COASTAL PLAIN OF EASTERN NORTH CAROLINA
